page.title: 12EASTNOR PARK
page.content: Each morning, the gamekeeper who lives on the deer park,looks after the pheasants and feeds them and puts nets on them.He then collects the pheasants eggs and puts them in the incubator to hatch out.They are then put in night pens. In July the grown pheasants are moved to the wood. The gamekeeper checks every day to see that none of the deer in the park get out.If any deer stray near the raspberry bushes, the keeper has to drive them away.Old deer are shot at a certain age when they are no longer suitable for venison or breeding. The gamekeeper also checks to see there are no poachers of the deer.He checks that no vermin or crows get to the corn crops,or steal eggs,and he shoots any culprits he finds.
